description: A midrange naus list that grinds value with Kraum as Armix deals with problematic creatures. This deck excels at being able to go very fast, but also has the interaction and grind plan to play a long game and control the board.
title: Armix Kraum Naus

description: Falco is a midrange deck designed to leverage simple win conditions alongside powerful top-deck manipulation and an extensive suite of interaction. Combos with Devoted Druid and Thought Lash represent the core of the deck. Generally powerful cards like Counterbalance can become oppressive when combined with the information Falco provides. Tutors such as Enlightened and Worldly become top-deck tutors with Falco on the battlefield, providing pseudo card advantage.
title: Falco Spara Midrange

decklists.title: Rocco Food Chain Stax AKA The Last Supper

description: Rocco is a flexible list looking to use Rocco to tutor up various pieces to be able to adapt to the game state quickly where necessary.
title: Rocco

description: Oskar easily cheats his own commander cost and breaks cheap discard outlets and Necropotence in half on his way to various Thoracle wins.
title: Oskar Discard Combo

description: A fast Grixis storm deck looking to win the game off Ad Nauseam, Peer into the Abyss or early wheels and assembling Underworld Breach lines or Thassa's Oracle and Demonic Consultation. Evelyn enables WGD combos very well and is an outlet in the command zone.
title: Evelyn WGD

description: Do you love attacking with creatures? Are the main cEDH wincons not your style and you just want to punch face? Do you want something similar to Godo yet not as linear? Then Rionya is perfect for you! Rionya can go fast with access to some turn one wins but usually gets there by turn 2-4 and she can give access to some mid-late game value if you couldn't get the quick win. She acts as both a combo piece and a value engine inside the command zone while being a strong blocker vs Tymna x decks.
title: Rionya Infinite Combats

description: This turbo deck utilizes it's commander to cast an early Ad Nauseam or aggressively loop spells from the graveyard to storm into a win via Brain Freeze or Thassa's oracle. It utilizes the graveyard heavily to be an incredibly fast and resilient Grixis deck with a unique twist over some of the other turbo naus decks around.
title: Cormela Turbo

description: A grindy Thrasios Hermit Druid deck with Breach layering
title: Thrasios Vial Hermit Druid

description: The Jund Dargo archetype is a Turbo Naus deck looking to cast an early Ad Nauseam or Peer into the Abyss to draw a large portion of the deck. It aims to use Dargo's cheap casting cost with cards that care about having a high mana value creature to use them with. Sacrifice and Burnt Offering grants you lots of mana, Greater Good to draw you lots of cards, or Eldritch Evolution to cheat Razaketh, the Foulblooded into play and use Dargo as your cheap sacrifice fodder to tutor out your wincons. The deck looks to win with either Dualcaster Mage combo, Breach, or Praetor's Grasp.
title: Dargo Ikra Raza Naus

description: A multi-layered midranged deck that can shift between either grinding out value or switch to combo lines including thoracle combo, breach, and dockside lines,.
title: Thrasios Vial Reanimator

description: This is a proactive midrange deck that seeks to win in the "midgame" by tutoring up Thassa's Oracle, Cephalid Illusionist and Nomad's en-Kor using Protean Hulk's LTB ability. "Breakfast Hulk" plays really well into a midrange heavy meta, with viability in any meta.
title: Thrasios Tymna Hulk

description: This is a turbo ad nauseam deck that uses its 0 mana commander to enable cards that are incredibly good in the archetype at a very early turn (e.g.: Mox Amber, Culling the Weak, Fierce Guardianship). The deck is incredibly fast, even when compared to other turbo naus commanders. The downside is that it loses out on a commander that grants card advantage.
title: Rograkh Silas Turbo Naus

description: This is a UB midrange Naus deck which focuses on powering out its commanders to set up value engines, while using the standard UB suite of cards to control and win the game. It utilizes HBH, Thoracle, and Doomsday as winconditions. Basically this is what I see as the baseline of UB in the format.
title: Malcolm Tevesh Midrange

description: This deck constantly threatens to win on turns two to four, but it can also play well in long games. The goal is to cast Demonic Consultation and Thassa's Oracle, which should be easy with the included draw engines, tutors and Ad Nauseam. It can also control the game until it wins with all the interaction it runs and with it's commander which allows us to recast wheels, tutors and interaction.
title: Dimir Gale

description:
Tymna Dargo is an adaptive Turbo Ad Nauseam that is oriented around leveraging Tymnas drawing power together with the combo potential and explosiveness that Dargo provides. 

By the nature of our commanders the deck can either be highly explosive or focus on advancing a board and draw off Tymna. 

Dargo as a partner for Tymna sits between Jeska and Rograkh as Dargo provides both a cheap body to exploit as well as a combo piece. The downside is that he requires a boardstate to enable him to cost reduce himself. The upside of this is that he also enables cards like burnt offering, sacrifice and rutheless technomancer, and the combos he enables are also very well layered with what the deck already wants to do. This allows for a high combo density with little trade off to the focus of the deck. The downside to this is we need a boardstate to enable Dargo.
title: Dargo Tymna Naus

description: Tymna Armix Board Control is a creature-based reanimator deck that seeks to slow down the game through the proactive use of hatebears and stax pieces before ultimately winning the game with Leonin Relic-Warder or Abdel Adrian. This deck is built to abuse the synergy between the commander pair, and utilizes Razaketh as a one-card combo. The unique synergy between the commanders, which allows the deck to remove hatebears, combo pieces, and value engines while drawing multiple cards a turn, makes the deck stronger against midrange decks when compared to other stax decks. While the deck is weak to graveyard and ETB hate, it can easily shift to beatdown with "winconless" win conditions like Elesh Norn.
title: Armix Tymna  Board Control

description: This deck utilizes Oskar's ability to ignore both timing restrictions and discard 'downsides' of cards to establish incredibly efficient wins on-demand, with a strong UB base to back it up.
title: Oskar

description:
This is a stax deck that focuses on combat taking advantage of the party mechanic thanks to the commander, which also helps with card advantage.

The main wincon will usually be combat damage while keeping everyone staxed, but there are also two combo lines:

-Professor Onyx + Chain of Smog: It can be assembled via Arena Rector (which is a cleric). Diabolic Intent on Arena Rector will get you both pieces (Professor Onyx into play and Chain of Smog into hand). We also play other sacrifice outlets like Viscera Seer (wizard) and Phyrexian Tower.
-Drannith Magistrate + Uba Mask
title: Nalia de'Arnise

description: An Esper deck that carries a high density of wincons. Having a one-card combo in Time Sieve makes Tivit an ever-present threat, while functioning as a hard to interact with value engine in the meantime.
title: Tivit

description: A midrange deck that seeks to leverage Raffine to provide card selection and pressure through damage, while having a high density of ways to break parity on her ability and generate value and advantage
title: Raffine Midrange

description: With our top-deck manipulation suite, this adaptive midrange list focuses on cheating in expensive control and value pieces like Mind's Dilation or Niv-Mizzet, Parun. After generating massive amounts of value, we can use Displacer Kitten or Hullbreaker Horror as 1 card win conditions to filter through our deck and assemble either breach combo, Niv-Mizzet wheels, or Time Twister loops for the win.
title: Neera Midrange

description: Temur Thrasios Midrange aims at using both it's commanders to gain advantage over the table and use evolution pieces to go infinite with Dockside Extortionist. Typically turns 4-5 while holding up interaction on turns 3-4 to stop wins.
title: Temur Thrasios Midrange

description: A proactive deck that aims to turbo out an Ad Nauseam/Peer into the Abyss or win through Food Chain using Rutstein as the outlet. Key cards such as Gaea's Blessing, Turn the Earth, Dryad's Revival, and Endurance enable for deck looping to generate infinite (or nearly infinite) treasure,  insect, and blood tokens before finishing with Finale of Devastation, Praetors' Grasp, or other options.
title: Old Rutstein Food Chain

description: A fast storm, Ad Nauseam centered deck, that utilizes it's commander for card advantage, storm count and pseudo-discount/ramp with cascade triggers. Extremely proactive, sacrificing grind potential for more powerful and harder to stop main plan.
title: Yidris Storm
